019package org.jdrupes.vmoperator.util;
020
021import java.math.BigDecimal;
022import java.math.BigInteger;
023import java.util.HashMap;
024import java.util.List;
025import java.util.Map;
026import java.util.regex.Pattern;
027
028/**
029 * Provides methods for parsing "official" memory sizes..
030 */
031@SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseUtilityClass")
032public class ParseUtils {
033
034    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap",
035        "PMD.FieldNamingConventions", "PMD.VariableNamingConventions" })
036    private static final Map<String, BigInteger> unitMap = new HashMap<>();
037    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.FieldNamingConventions",
038        "PMD.VariableNamingConventions" })
039    private static final Pattern memorySize
040        = Pattern.compile("^\\s*(\\d+(\\.\\d+)?)\\s*([A-Za-z]*)\\s*");
041
042    static {
043        // SI units and common abbreviations
044        BigInteger factor = BigInteger.ONE;
045        unitMap.put("", factor);
046        BigInteger scale = BigInteger.valueOf(1000);
047        for (var unit : List.of("B", "kB", "MB", "GB", "TB", "PB", "EB")) {
048            unitMap.put(unit, factor);
049            factor = factor.multiply(scale);
050        }
051        // Binary units
052        factor = BigInteger.valueOf(1024);
053        scale = BigInteger.valueOf(1024);
054        for (var unit : List.of("KiB", "MiB", "GiB", "TiB", "PiB", "EiB")) {
055            unitMap.put(unit, factor);
056            factor = factor.multiply(scale);
057        }
058    }
059
060    /**
061     * Parses a memory size specification.
062     *
063     * @param amount the amount
064     * @return the big integer
065     */
066    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
067    public static BigInteger parseMemory(Object amount) {
068        if (amount == null) {
069            return (BigInteger) amount;
070        }
071        if (amount instanceof BigInteger number) {
072            return number;
073        }
074        if (amount instanceof Number number) {
075            return BigInteger.valueOf(number.longValue());
076        }
077        var matcher = memorySize.matcher(amount.toString());
078        if (!matcher.matches()) {
079            throw new NumberFormatException(amount.toString());
080        }
081        var unit = BigInteger.ONE;
082        if (matcher.group(3) != null) {
083            unit = unitMap.get(matcher.group(3));
084            if (unit == null) {
085                throw new NumberFormatException("Illegal unit \""
086                    + matcher.group(3) + "\" in \"" + amount.toString() + "\"");
087            }
088        }
089        var number = matcher.group(1);
090        return new BigDecimal(number).multiply(new BigDecimal(unit))
091            .toBigInteger();
092    }
093
094}
